page.title: 01BISHOP BURTON AREA
page.content: This block lies in the{County of {North Humberside}(until recently the {East Riding of Yorkshire)} and covers an area of mainly{arable farmland}on the edge of the Wolds. {Bishop Burton}is a small rural village situated in the north-east section of the block and lies 2.5 miles from the historic market town of {Beverley.}The main York-Beverley road, the A1079, passes through the village. Originally, it was an estate village. The population is now 370, mostly people not involved directly with agriculture. It has a{church and {chapel, a post office/shop, a village {hall, a small primary school and inn. {N. Humberside county agricultural {college}is based at Bishop Burton. Farm holdings are large, arable and commonly have secondary livestock enterprises associated.
